As the climate crisis worsens, these inequities will only build. Our commitment to environmental justice must include climate-focused infrastructure that protects all communities against the dangerous effects of our warming planet.

If temperatures increase as predicted, low-income residents without a diploma will experience more flooding and lost work hours. Latinos will be 43% more likely to lose work hours because it’s too hot. American Indians and Alaskan Natives will be 37% more likely.

Black people are 40% more likely to live in places where extreme temperatures will result in higher mortality rates. They are also 41 – 59% more likely to die as a result of poor air quality, and black children are 34% – 40% more likely to be diagnosed with asthma.

Our UI system is broken. It has been for decades. We failed to fix it after the Great Recession, and state after state sabotaged it by making benefits harder to access. It’s difficult for the unemployment system to work in a crisis when it’s been neglected and sabotaged.

Unfortunately, the false narrative that workers were refusing to go back to work was endlessly repeated and allowed to take hold, even while all evidence has shown that isn’t the truth. It gave Republican governors cover to cause workers needless pain to score political points.

Millions of jobless workers are going to suffer when benefits expire on Monday, and it didn’t need to be this way. It’s clear from the economic and health conditions on the ground that we shouldn’t be cutting off benefits now.

The fate of American workers rests in the revitalization of the labor movement. 

Today, I celebrate their accomplishments with my brothers and sisters in the CWA and across the entire labor movement and wish all of you a safe and happy Labor Day.

The brave women and men of the labor movement made their demands and built their power and with it built the American middle-class. It is no coincidence that as union membership has declined over the last 40 years, so too have wages remained flat and the middle-class has shrunk.

Institutions like OSHA, the National Labor Relations Board, and even Social Security are part of that legacy. 

Frederick Douglass said, “power concedes nothing without demand, it never has and never will.”

By organizing and making collective demands, by demonstrating their collective power through strikes, slowdowns and boycotts, they were able to wrestle from their bosses some of the benefits that we take for granted: better wages, 8 hour day, safer working conditions and so on.

Happy #LaborDay weekend.

As you spend time with family and friends this weekend, keep in mind the sacrifices American workers have made. Men and women gave their literal blood, sweat, and tears to demand a better life for themselves, their families, and their fellow workers. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1433907355142529024/pu/img/iizu2MkXyusDOeKU.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1433907355142529024/pu/vid/480x270/lSZbIrFTbWXrULdH.mp4?tag=12
